replies.body:
I am so pissed! Can you guys add in a "troll vote" dodge system in champ select? I just had a ranked game I had to dodge because of an ADC/Bot Thresh{{champion:412}} pick. The player legit even said they were trolling, locked in and everything. Please address this issue for the future! Make so that if you get voted as "Troll Picking" too many times in ranked that you are banned from ranked for a period of time. 

I play 4-5 ranked games a day and see this happen way too often!

This is a really good idea. Although it may get some people banned for playing certain champions in off roles or just picking off meta champions. I can also see issues with a 3-4 man party abusing their numbers.

I would want to have the player be notified and get to write a short letter explaining their pick.  If they are a Galio one trick and know how to jg Galio well then then they should be able to mention this to defend their pick.  Some people play off meta shit in unusual positions and do pretty damn well with it.  They shouldn't be punished by over reactors without getting a say.

If they are obviously trolling that is one thing, but off meta is a thing that does have to be explained and defended by virtue of what it is.

Fair in principle, but very hard to implement. That's the whole problem. Riot can't police the million+ players and needs to depend on players themselves to police each other. :/ Who is going to read the letter and judge? 

(Unless they bring back "The Tribunal" :-) )

I completely agree, and am happy to see someone think the same way I do. I sometimes do play Top Tank {{champion:202}} and Jungle {{champion:4}} , though I haven't gotten reported for picking those, I have gotten harassed and threatened; however, I absolutely LOVE breaking the meta, so I stay at it. And yes, in Ranked. In fact, the two picks I used to carry myself through high gold were Jungle {{champion:4}} and AP {{champion:5}} (I'm still mad at RIOT for nerfing AP {{champion:5}} and taking out revive for no more MS {{champion:120}} though). Anyways, had to get that off my chest, have a good day everyone!
I play Urgot mid and bot and have a 60% winrate (granted, in very low elo) on him right now. Doesn't stop people from flaming me for "trolling."
More people need to embrace the magic that is Urgot. Keep on keepin' on!
Urgod*
same for ryze jg ;p
I got into gold 5 last night with 4 straight Urgod wins in top lane
I'd also add that such a "vote off troll" ability not be implemented in normals, where you're free to pick off-meta or "for fun" picks to learn them.

Great idea! Let's discourage any creative play by reporting them if we don't agree with how they choose to play their champion! But seriously though, this is why NA gets crushed by Asian countries because they don't follow the stereotypical ways NA players think a champion must be played. Why do we like to limit things so much that there is only one correct way to play a champion? If the guy is clearing trolling and admits it that's one thing but having a vote like that will eventually turn into, "I don't understand why he would play a champion there so he MUST be trolling." 

It's the same if I want to try a different build than what's acceptable. I tend to get flamed like crazy because I didn't build the way I SHOULD have built. Many times it has nothing to do with how well I am doing. I could be leading the team in kills but the second we start losing it MUST have been my atypical build that caused the loss. Sometimes I want to try to push the boundaries and see what's possible and this kind of change would tell people it's not ok.

I understand what you are saying, but there is a difference between ADC/Bot LeBlanc VS Miss Fortune Mid. I am not against creative builds and roles when it works with the comp. A lot of the time though off-picks are putting you at a disadvantage unless the other team is also just as messed up.

I would even be fine with a Kalista Mid who bonds with the Tank Jungler. There is a big difference between "potential win" and "likely a loss".

No you just want riot to censor people you disagree with because you believe you're so important that, anyone who doesn't play like you, or do as you say is a troll. You are spineless soft and willfuly ignorant to anything that doesn't fit into your narrow idea of how the game should be played,sadly people like you  being catered to by riot, is the reason this community is the worst in gaming.

http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/hypocrite

Literally everything you just said is diametrically opposed to the manner in which you said it. 

YOU are intolerant. YOU are trying to censor (or at least discredit) those who disagree with you. YOU are the kind of person that riot caters to with respect to this issue (hence why no such vote-to-disband option exists), and YOU are the kind of person that makes this community the worst in gaming. Kindly see yourself out.

same I like creative shit just I hate when people flame a lot or pick shity comps ( as in don't picks from the team comps just for themselves ) and when people fight in lobby they are usually bound to flame in game and that's like a 20 percent chance for them to lose there game, the problem is I am on there to so them being mad makes me lose the game I think there should b a vote in ranked q that if your team is flaming in lobby you can vote to disband.  Many times I've lost games because of shit that went down in the lobby which is ridicoulis!!!!
NO..just no when people already report u for picking off meta stuff even when u carry.
He said that the {{champion:412}} admitted to trolling. If they said they were legit good, thats a different thing.
They should allow 1 dodge per day/week, therefore players will not hesitate and lose games.

Something like this, yes, but without LP loss of course. 

Perhaps you could earn these "dodges" based on number of ranked games played. Like every 3rd ranked game played to a Win or Loss/ff you earn 1 free "dodge". They can then be saved for when you need them.
You lose 2 LP....it doesn't matter....
3 and if you in your promos and client crashes counts as a dodge and you lose your free win so no, it does matter client crashed in 3 divisional promos of mine and didnt get the win
nice but the storage has a cap of like 2 or else people will dodge every single game ( they should be harder to get for this same reason )

While not entirely a bad idea in the least bit, it's likely too easily abused to simply get players banned for not either banning or picking the most meta champ at the time. Like last year when GP and Morde were pick or ban 80% of the time haha

I mean seeing as they already weight reports by number of reports in a single game (if all 9 people in a game report someone it hits the top of the stack), and the system already knows who is queuing together, it wouldnt take much to tweak the weighting to avoid premades abusing people. Also it doesnt necessarily have to end in a ban, it could be just be a disband of the lobby. This way it could be up to the team whether they want to play with that off meta pick or not with no repercussions. You can be the best heimerdinger jg in the world, but if I'm in my promos, especially a last game, I definitely dont want to see something that volatile show up on my team, and I'd like some control over it other than eating the dodge.

I feel a better thing to do would be to have a vote similar to what you said but instead of banning have it just be a group dodge where no dodge penalty is there.So for players who are not okay playing with non-meta things,they don't have to and players that are ok can accept it. Just make em dodge with no penalty to it.

It's not like nobody could see the outcome of this idiocy way before it went live.

Thank you very fucking much for worthless tests like that.

First off. the chat restriction is nothing but your own doing. You are probably the kind of person who would always say, 'Mid or feed.'  I have yet to have a single problem with this queue. It is better than going into ranked and maybe getting a role you're good at or just getting something you are terrible at.

For me, I am bad at mid and ADC. So this Dynamic Queue is awesome for me Now I can duo and find someone who likes either of those roles and I am perfectly fine and have a 98% chance to not get one of those roles.

I love the new update for it and look forward to more. Riot is doing a good job. Keep it up!

I understand that the queue times would be much much longer, especially for dynamic queue, but i personally will not mind it since it'd be great to have a choice to avoid quads/ trios that would crush my balls.{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

I've run into trio/quad groups very often lately that will troll the solo players. In ranked and even more in normals.

They ban your champ deliberately, can 4 man report you if you try to say or do anything they don't like, and are not fun to play with at all.

There needs to be a TRUE solo queue. Where all players are solo, matched with and against other solo players.

Please add this option to ranked and normals so we can choose, even at the cost of longer wait times, to avoid teams.

Not all teams are bad, but more and more it creates unhealthy gameplay. Teams upset with the solo player or solo players upset with the teams.

These guys are like corrupt politicians only doing work for the top 1%, except that politicians at least pretend to care about the rest of the community....

You DO realize the top 1% have it the worst? This isn't "catering", it's trying to give them an enjoyable experience. Have you ever waited 40 minutes to get into a game? It's not fun. And HOW is not being allowed to queue up more than duo considered a positive special treatment? Same with autofill, something I'm sure you've never had to deal with. I mean I hella agree with it, but it's a negative necessity.
